com.github.methylene.sym

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.methylene.sym.Util

  • public final class Util
extends Object
    A collection of array related utility methods.

             int end,
             boolean inclusive)
        Creates an array of the numbers start to end in sequence.
        Parameters:
        start - a number
        end - a number
        inclusive - whether or not the greater of start and end should be included in the result
        Returns:
        the sequence from start to end

      • sequence

        public static int[] sequence(int end)
        Creates an array of the numbers 0 (included) to end (excluded) in sequence. If end == 0 an empty array is returned.
        Parameters:
        end - a non-negative number
        Returns:
        an array of length end
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if end is negative

      • indexOf

        public static int indexOf(int[] a,
          int el,
          int skip)
        Find element in array by comparing each element in sequence, starting at index 0.
        Parameters:
        a - an array
        el - a number
        skip - The number of matching elements to skip. Passing a negative number as skip has the same effect as passing 0: the index of the first match, if any, will be returned.
        Returns:
        the least non-negative number i so that a[i] = el, or -1 if el is not found in a.

        Returns:

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if n is negative

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • padding

        public static int[] padding(int[] a,
            int targetLength)
        Add sequence numbers at the end of given array. If the input array is not shorter than the input, it is returned. Otherwise a new array is created.
        Parameters:
        a - an array
        targetLength - a non negative number
        Returns:
        the array b defined as b[i] = a[i] if i < a.length, and b[i] = i if a.length <= i < targetLength

      • duplicateIndexes

        public static int[] duplicateIndexes(int[] input,
                     int start)
        Find a pair of duplicate indexes.
        Parameters:
        input -
        start - the index where to start looking in the array
        Returns:
        A pair i, j of indexes so that input[i] == input[j]
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if no duplicates were found

      • distinctInts

        public static int[] distinctInts(int size,
                 int maxFactor)
        Produce an array of distinct random numbers.
        Parameters:
        size - length of array to generate
        maxFactor - controls the size of random numbers that are generated. All generated numbers will be smaller than size * maxFactor. This number must be not be less than 2.
        Returns:
        a random array of size distinct nonnegative integers, all less than size * maxFactor
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if factor is less than 2

      • symbols

        public static String[] symbols(int n)
        Generates an array of distinct strings of the requested length. The array always starts with "a" and then all lower case one letter strings in lexicographic order. Next come all lowercase two letter strings starting with "aa", in lexicographic order. Note that the array returned by this method is sorted if and only if n < 27, because "b".compareTo("aa") > 0.
        Parameters:
        n - length of array to generate
        Returns:
        a list of distinct strings of length n

      • randomNumbers

        public static int[] randomNumbers(int maxNumber,
                  int length)
        Produce length random numbers between 0 and maxNumber
        Parameters:
        maxNumber - upper bound of random numbers
        length - result length
        Returns:
        an array of random numbers
